<div>\n  It takes the brightest minds to be a technology leader. It takes imagination to create green energy for the generations to come. At Siemens Gamesa we make real what matters, join our global team.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n    Position Overview\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n    Siemens Gamesa Renewable Energy is currently seeking highly talented and motivated candidates for a Wind Technician position. The candidate will work together with a multi-disciplinary group to ensure top performance on our wind farms. The ideal candidate has the ability to work a flexible schedule, along with the ability to analyze and resolve problems independently and efficiently. They will provide excellent service to our customers, have the ability to work on complex systems in challenging environments, and participate in the development of new field procedures and best practices. Safety and Quality form a central part of our culture, and the ideal candidate will have a strong focus on both.\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n    This position will be for a new wind farm which will be located in Alberta (Calgary \u002F Drumheller area).\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n    Relocation may be offered for this role should it be necessary.\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n    Requirements\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     The ideal candidate will have the ability to diagnose and resolve problems independently and efficiently. They will provide excellent service to our customers, could work on complex systems in challenging environments, and participate in the development of new field procedures and best practices. Safety and Quality form a central part of our culture, and the ideal candidate will have a strong focus on both.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Travel could be over 50% in the first <div>\n  It takes the brightest minds to be a technology leader. It takes imagination to create green energy for the generations to come. At Siemens Gamesa we make real what matters, join our global team.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Position Overview\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Join one of the world’s leading suppliers of wind power solutions as a Wind Technician for Siemens Gamesa Renewable Energy! Demand for electricity generated from renewable sources is growing fast, and Siemens Gamesa Renewable Energy has the answers. As one of the market leaders, we combine technological innovations, experience, and expertise to deliver readily available, one-stop solutions and have a proven track record of successfully delivering wind power projects on all continents. SGRE is currently seeking a highly talented and motivated candidate for a Wind Technician position. The candidate will work together with a multi-disciplinary group to ensure top performance on Wind Farms ranging from the Woodstock to Windsor area. The ideal candidate can work a flexible schedule, along with the ability to analyze and resolve problems independently and efficiently. S\u002Fhe will provide excellent service to our customers, can work on complex systems in challenging environments, and participate in the development of new field procedures and best practices. The candidate, with an already active partner, will be responsible for two Senvion sites operations which are in Woodstock and Harrow Ontario. Ideally the candidate would be located in the London, ON area. The candidate would also assist at other sites, as needed, throughout Southwestern Ontario.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Responsibilities\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li> Provide excellent service to our customers, analyze, and react to people in stressful hazardous situations<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Participate in the development of new improved field procedures and best practices<\u002Fli>\n  <li> The working environment entails working inside the wind turbine enclosure at an elevated height of 300 feet<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Ability to think clearly and maintain composure during stressful and or hazardous situations is a critical ability to working in confined spaces<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Extensive training and testing will be provided covering safety and technical job requirements<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Physical requirements of the job include but not limited to: Ladder climbing minimum 267 steps, up stair climbing, standing for long periods, walking, lifting, bending, twisting, work above shoulders, pushing, pulling, exposure to vibration, chemicals, confined spaces and extreme weather conditions<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Able to expand technical ability<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Capable of efficiently taking on additional roles and responsibilities at an operating wind farm<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Performs mainly pre-defined, technical tasks (for example, basic commissioning of products and systems, integration of components to a system, basic engineering, maintenance jobs) and work packages on-site and remotely.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Supports customers remotely and onsite and provide 2nd and 3rd level user support in case of arising issues.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Coordinates and accomplishes defined service operations and\u002For resolves product issues for customers equipment.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Supports in generating sales leads for pre-defined service offers and contributes to planning activities.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Adheres to defined processes and applicable regulations.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Qualifications:\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li> Turbine experience, especially Senvion Platform is preferred<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Demonstrated knowledge in electrical systems including such as PLC programming and converters<\u002Fli>\n  <li> College Diploma or equivalent competency in a field related to the work of a wind farm technician ie: electrical \u002F mechanical systems<\u002Fli>\n  <li> The candidate must demonstrate strong initiative and motivation to learn new technology and translate learning into personal success<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Excellent customer service skills and communication skills are required<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Demonstrated ability to work safely and effectively in a team environment<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Strong ability to organize and plan daily\u002Fweekly work with a high level of quality orientation, ability to analyze and resolve problems independently with a high level of results orientation<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Good computer skills, is competent in the use of Microsoft platforms like Outlook and Excel<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Must be legally able to work in Canada, and presently reside in Canada. Also, travel to customer sites within and outside Canada is a requirement of the job. Must be eligible to hold a valid Passport and Driver’s License<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   #Entry\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   To learn more about Siemens Gamesa, check out these videos:\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Empowering our people\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n    https:\u002F\u002Fwww.siemensgamesa.com\u002Fsustainability\u002Femployees\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <br> How do you imagine the future?\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n    https:\u002F\u002Fyoutu.be\u002F12Sm678tjuY\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Siemens Gamesa Renewable Energy Limited (SGRE) is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. <div>\n  It takes the brightest minds to be a technology leader. It takes imagination to create green energy for the generations to come. At Siemens Gamesa we make real what matters, join our global team.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Siemens Gamesa Renewable Energy is currently seeking highly talented and motivated candidates for a Wind Technician position. The candidate will work together with a multi-disciplinary group to ensure top performance on our wind farms. The ideal candidate has the ability to work a flexible schedule, along with the ability to analyze and resolve problems independently and efficiently. They will provide excellent service to our customers, have the ability to work on complex systems in challenging environments, and participate in the development of new field procedures and best practices. Safety and Quality form a central part of our culture, and the ideal candidate will have a strong focus on both.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   This position will be for a new wind farm which will be located in Alberta (Medicine Hat area).\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Relocation may be offered for this role should it be necessary. They will provide excellent service to our customers, could work on complex systems in challenging environments, and participate in the development of new field procedures and best practices. Safety and Quality form a central part of our culture, and the ideal candidate will have a strong focus on both.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Travel could be over 50% in the first year of employment for training purposes, followed by 10% travel in the following years per business needs.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Responsibilities:\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li> Service and maintenance of wind turbines<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Troubleshoot errors on wind turbine<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Escalate technical issues to supporting engineering functions<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Although this position will have a home wind farm site, it will at times require supporting other sites across Canada, as needed<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Provide excellent service to our customers<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Participate in the development of new improved field procedures and best practices<\u002Fli>\n  <li> The working environment entails working inside the wind turbine enclosure at an elevated height of ~ 300 feet<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Ability to think clearly and maintain composure during stressful and or hazardous situations is a critical ability to working in confined spaces<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Extensive training and testing will be provided covering safety and technical job requirements<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Physical requirements of the job include but not limited to: Ladder climbing minimum 250 steps, up stair climbing, standing for long periods, walking, lifting, bending, twisting, work above shoulders, pushing, pulling, exposure to vibration, chemicals, confined spaces and extreme weather conditions<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Able to expand technical ability<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Capable of efficiently taking on additional roles and responsibilities at an operating wind farm<\u002Fli>\n <li> Physically and mentally able to work suspended from heights and in confined spaces<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Flexible travel schedule<\u002Fli>\n  <li> High school diploma or equivalent<\u002Fli>\n  <li> which will be located in Alberta (Drumheller area near Stettler).\n    <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Responsibilities:\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Responsible for the service and maintenance of Siemens Gamesa wind turbines at our Alberta Wind Turbine site\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Although this position will analyze and react to people in stressful hazardous situations\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Participate in the development of new improved field procedures and best practices\n <div>\n  It takes the brightest minds to be a technology leader. It takes imagination to create green energy for the generations to come. At Siemens Gamesa we make real what matters, join our global team.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n    Siemens Gamesa Renewable Energy is currently seeking highly talented and motivated candidates for a Wind Technician position. The candidate will work together with a multi-disciplinary group to ensure top performance on our wind farms. The ideal candidate has the ability to work a flexible schedule, along with the ability to analyze and resolve problems independently and efficiently. They will provide excellent service to our customers, have the ability to work on complex systems in challenging environments, and participate in the development of new field procedures and best practices. Safety and Quality form a central part of our culture, and the ideal candidate will have a strong focus on both.\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Position Overview\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li> The ideal candidate will have the ability to diagnose and resolve problems independently and efficiently. They will provide excellent service to our customers, could work on complex systems in challenging environments, and participate in the development of new field procedures and best practices. Safety and Quality form a central part of our culture, and the ideal candidate will have a strong focus on both.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Travel could be over 50% in the first year of employment for training purposes, followed by 10% travel in the following years per business needs.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Responsibilities:\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li> Service and maintenance of wind turbines<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Troubleshoot errors on wind turbine<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Escalate technical issues to supporting engineering functions<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Although this position will have a home wind farm site, it will at times require supporting other sites across Canada, as needed<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Provide excellent service to our customers<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Participate in the development of new improved field procedures and best practices<\u002Fli>\n  <li> The working environment entails working inside the wind turbine enclosure at an elevated height of ~ 300 feet<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Ability to think clearly and maintain composure during stressful and or hazardous situations is a critical ability to working in confined spaces<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Extensive training and testing will be provided covering safety and technical job requirements<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Physical requirements of the job include but not limited to: Ladder climbing minimum 250 steps, up stair climbing, standing for long periods, walking, lifting, bending, twisting, work above shoulders, pushing, pulling, exposure to vibration, chemicals, confined spaces and extreme weather conditions<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Able to expand technical ability<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Capable of efficiently taking on additional roles and responsibilities at an operating wind farm<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Required Knowledge\u002F Skills, Education, and Experience\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li> Driving is an essential function of the job and applicants must have a valid driver’s license at the time of application with an acceptable driving record. Employees must maintain a valid license and acceptable driving record and may be subject to periodic driver’s abstract checks<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Must be eligible to hold a valid Passport<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Physically and mentally able to work suspended from heights and in confined spaces<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Flexible travel schedule<\u002Fli>\n  <li> High school diploma or equivalent<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Be self-motivated, able to think quickly and address issues as they arise<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Demonstrated ability to work safely and effectively in a team environment<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Excellent customer service skills and communication skills are required<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Strong ability to organize and plan daily\u002Fweekly work with a high level of quality orientation<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Good computer skills, is competent in the use of Microsoft platforms like Outlook and Excel<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Must meet body weight restrictions of 265 pounds or less as required by the safety regulations<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Must pass a physical administered by a medical practitioner to ensure ability to safely perform the job functions and meet the physical demands of the position<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Must pass pre-hire background screening<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Must be legally able to work in Canada<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Preferred <div>\n  It takes the brightest minds to be a technology leader. It takes imagination to create green energy for the generations to come. At Siemens Gamesa we make real what matters, join our global team.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n    Position Overview\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n    Siemens Gamesa Renewable Energy is currently seeking highly talented and motivated candidates for a Wind Technician position. The candidate will work together with a multi-disciplinary group to ensure top performance on our wind farms. The ideal candidate has the ability to work a flexible schedule, along with the ability to analyze and resolve problems independently and efficiently. They will provide excellent service to our customers, have the ability to work on complex systems in challenging environments, and participate in the development of new field procedures and best practices. Safety and Quality form a central part of our culture, and the ideal candidate will have a strong focus on both.\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n    This position will be for a new wind farm which will be located in Alberta (Calgary \u002F Drumheller area).\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Responsibilities:\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li> Responsible for the service and maintenance of Siemens Gamesa wind turbines at our Alberta Wind Turbine site<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Although this position will have a home wind farm site, it will at times require supporting other sites across Canada, as needed<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Provide excellent service to our customers, analyze and react to people in stressful hazardous situations<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Participate in the development of new improved field procedures and best practices<\u002Fli>\n  <li> The working environment entails working inside the wind turbine enclosure at an elevated height of ~ 300 feet<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Ability to think clearly and maintain composure during stressful and or hazardous situations is a critical ability to working in confined spaces<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Extensive training and testing will be provided covering safety and technical job requirements<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Physical requirements of the job include but not limited to: Ladder climbing minimum 267 steps, up stair climbing, standing for long periods, walking, lifting, bending, twisting, work above shoulders, pushing, pulling, exposure to vibration, chemicals, confined spaces and extreme weather conditions<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Able to expand technical ability<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Capable of efficiently taking on additional roles and responsibilities at an operating wind farm<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Travel included in a year would be up to 20%<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Qualifications:\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li> Demonstrated knowledge in electrical systems including such as PLC programming and converters<\u002Fli>\n  <li> College Diploma or equivalent competency in a field related to the work of a wind farm technician ie: electrical \u002F mechanical systems<\u002Fli>\n  <li> The candidate must demonstrate strong initiative and motivation to learn new technology and translate learning into personal success<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Excellent customer service skills and communication skills are required<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Demonstrated ability to work safely and effectively in a team environment<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Strong ability to organize and plan daily\u002Fweekly work with a high level of quality orientation, ability to analyze and resolve problems independently with a high level of results orientation<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Good computer skills, is competent in the use of Microsoft platforms like Outlook and Excel<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Travel to customer sites within and outside Canada is a requirement of the job.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Must be eligible to hold a valid Passport and <div>\n  It takes the brightest minds to be a technology leader. It takes imagination to create green energy for the generations to come. At Siemens Gamesa we make real what matters, join our global team.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n    Siemens Gamesa Renewable Energy is currently seeking highly talented and motivated candidates for a Wind Technician position. The candidate will work together with a multi-disciplinary group to ensure top performance on our wind farms. The ideal candidate has the ability to work a flexible schedule, along with the ability to analyze and resolve problems independently and efficiently. They will provide excellent service to our customers, have the ability to work on complex systems in challenging environments, and participate in the development of new field procedures and best practices. Safety and Quality form a central part of our culture, and the ideal candidate will have a strong focus on both.\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n    This position will be for a new wind farm which will be located in Alberta (Medicine Hat area).\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Responsibilities:\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li> Responsible for the service and maintenance of Siemens Gamesa wind turbines at our Alberta Wind Turbine site<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Although this position will have a home wind farm site, it will at times require supporting other sites across Canada, as needed<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Provide excellent service to our customers, analyze and react to people in stressful hazardous situations<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Participate in the development of new improved field procedures and best practices<\u002Fli>\n  <li> The working environment entails working inside the wind turbine enclosure at an elevated height of ~ 300 feet<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Ability to think clearly and maintain composure during stressful and or hazardous situations is a critical ability to working in confined spaces<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Extensive training and testing will be provided covering safety and technical job requirements<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Physical requirements of the job include but not limited to: Ladder climbing minimum 267 steps, up stair climbing, standing for long periods, walking, lifting, bending, twisting, work above shoulders, pushing, pulling, exposure to vibration, chemicals, confined spaces and extreme weather conditions<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Able to expand technical ability<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Capable of efficiently taking on additional roles and responsibilities at an operating wind farm<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Travel included in a year would be up to 20%<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Qualifications:\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li> Demonstrated knowledge in electrical systems<\u002Fli>\n  <li> The candidate must demonstrate required<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Demonstrated ability to work safely and effectively in a team environment<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Strong ability to organize and plan daily\u002Fweekly work with a high level of quality orientation, ability to analyze and resolve problems independently with a high level of results orientation<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Good computer skills, is competent in the use of Microsoft <div>\n  It takes the brightest minds to be a technology leader. It takes imagination to create green energy for the generations to come. At Siemens Gamesa we make real what matters, join our global team.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <br> Position Overview\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Engage in a dynamic and quick-growing industry that empowers tomorrow’s future by aiding us to support complex field corrections and maintenance dispositions for our American fleet of SGRE wind turbines. The Engineer will oversee coordinating “assigned” Customer’s technical issues for disposition through the engineering team. The engineer will also present status and resolution at customer business reviews and be the main focal point for the Operations team. A successful candidate demonstrates a good grasp of knowledge and principles of field of specialization and applications and should be able to articulate successful completion of assignments. A successful candidate must also be able to demonstrate how one applies knowledge of fundamental concepts, practices, and procedures of area of specialization. Additionally, the successful candidate is expected to support with other responsibilities in Customer Service Engineering team, like sales support activities, technical project management (for major cases).\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Typically, 8+ years of successful experience in related field and successful demonstration of Key Responsibilities and Knowledge as presented above.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Responsibilities\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li> Lead Technical Coordination for assigned primary key customers. Coordinate technical discussions for remaining customers.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Support the region operational engineering team by providing Feedback of customer relation.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Support the region operational engineering team by being the focal point for all pre-sales support cases and requests.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Support regional customer service engineering head with regional customer Corporate forums (customer technical forums, quarterly business reviews… etc.) or coordinate experts’ support as needed.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Prepare and assist to customer meetings (face to face or conference call, video) when requested and agreed to lead on priority topics.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Escalate through the Support process and standard tools the customer issues that require resolution.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Coordinate with other TAMs to share customer experience and issues (common issues, customer communications).<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Coordinate the immediate generation of customer technical responses to issues escalated to the second level when possible.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Review and communicate to the commercial counterpart customer technical reports or scopes for quote.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Coordinate with presales team within customer service engineering and help facilitate or support customer discussions on aftermarket projects.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Ensure coordination and alignment on global issues. Align technical messages to be deliver to the customers. Regional technology, global technology, and software solutions (where applicable) are aligned with the same technical messages.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Coordinate with SCADA technical account management to ensure SCADA technical topics from customer are addressed.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Stay coordinated with the Global Technical Account Manager (where one is assigned to that account) on critical issues although initially were not so considered and provide feedback of experience available worldwide.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Expected travel up to 10% to customer meetings and conferences.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Qualified applicants must be legally authorized for employment in the Canada. Qualified applicants will not require employer sponsored work authorization now or in the future for employment in Canada.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Qualified applicants may be allowed remote working opportunities, based on business needs.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Required Knowledge\u002FSkills, Education, and Experience\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Typically BS in electrical\u002Fmechanical\u002Faerospace discipline. <div>\n  It takes the brightest minds to be a technology leader. It takes imagination to create green energy for the generations to come. At Siemens Gamesa we make real what matters, join our global team.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Position Overview\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   The Material Management Specialist serves as focal point for optimal material and spares coordination for the assigned sites. One of its primary functions is to conduct yearly inventory count and analyze variances leading to final reconciliation for the wind farms assigned within region North America. In addition, serve as primary support for issues encountered by the assigned sites in ordering, receiving, and system training. The role works in constant collaboration with site management, project management, order management, finance, and other materials managers by coordinating system and process flow. The position requires travel within assigned area. The role reports into the centralized Resource Management and Planning organization within North America.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Responsibilities:\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Performs required cycle counts for assigned sites and analyzes inventory variances using SAP transactions, physical inspection, other supporting systems and documentation.\n site management teams\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Application of Lean Principles for warehouse operations\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Goods issue of spare parts to Wind Turbines\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Pick\u002FPack materials for shipping as required\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Visually inspect materials\u002Ftools for shipping damage, wear, missing parts, or other unsatisfactory conditions\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Work closely with Inventory Control Supervisor in Demand for electricity generated from renewable sources is growing fast, and Siemens Gamesa Renewable Energy has the answers. As one of the market leaders, we combine technological innovations, experience, and expertise to deliver readily available, one-stop solutions and have a proven track record of successfully delivering wind power projects on all continents. SGRE is currently seeking highly talented and motivated candidates for Wind Service Technician positions.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Location:\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   DrumHeller, AB (Hanna, Wheatland, Garden Plain, Hilda, Hand Hill)\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Relocation may be offered for this role should it be necessary. We will also provide GWO (Global Wind Organization) training.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Position Overview\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li> The ideal candidate will have the ability to diagnose and resolve problems independently and efficiently. They will provide excellent service to our customers, could work on complex systems in challenging environments, and participate in the development of new field procedures and best practices. Safety and Quality form a central part of our culture, and the ideal candidate will have a strong focus on both.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Travel could be over 50% in the first year of employment for training purposes, followed by 10% travel in the following years per business needs.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Responsibilities:\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li> Service and maintenance of wind turbines<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Troubleshoot errors on wind turbine<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Escalate technical issues to supporting engineering functions<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Although this position will have a home wind farm site, it will at times require supporting other sites across Canada, as needed<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Provide excellent service to our customers<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Participate in the development of new improved field procedures and best practices<\u002Fli>\n  <li> The working environment entails working inside the wind turbine enclosure at an elevated height of ~ 300 feet<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Ability to think clearly and maintain composure during stressful and or hazardous situations is a critical ability to working in confined spaces<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Extensive training and testing will be provided covering safety and technical job requirements<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Physical requirements of the job include but not limited to: Ladder climbing minimum 250 steps, up stair climbing, standing for long periods, walking, lifting, bending, twisting, work above shoulders, pushing, pulling, exposure to vibration, chemicals, confined spaces and extreme weather conditions<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Able to expand technical ability<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Capable of efficiently taking on additional roles and responsibilities at an operating wind farm<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Required Knowledge\u002F Skills, Education, and Experience\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li> Driving is an essential function of the job and applicants must have a valid driver’s license at the time of application with an acceptable driving record. Employees must maintain a valid license and acceptable driving record and may be subject to periodic driver’s abstract checks<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Must be eligible to hold a valid Passport<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Physically and mentally able to work suspended from heights and in confined spaces<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Flexible travel schedule<\u002Fli>\n  <li> High school diploma or equivalent<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Be self-motivated, able to think quickly and address issues as they arise<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Demonstrated ability to work safely and effectively in a team environment<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Excellent customer service skills and communication skills are required<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Strong ability to organize and plan daily\u002Fweekly work with a high level of quality orientation<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Good computer skills, is competent in the use of Microsoft platforms like Outlook and Excel<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Must meet body weight restrictions of 265 pounds or less as required by the safety regulations<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Must pass a physical administered by a medical practitioner to ensure ability to safely perform the job functions and meet the physical demands of the position<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Must pass pre-hire background screening<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Must be legally able to work in Canada<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Preferred <div>\n  It takes the brightest minds to be a technology leader. It takes imagination to create green energy for the generations to come. At Siemens Gamesa we make real what matters, join our global team.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Wind Service Technicians – Western Canada\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Join one of the world’s leading suppliers of wind power solutions as a Wind Technician for Siemens Gamesa Renewable Energy! Demand for electricity generated from renewable sources is growing fast, and Siemens Gamesa Renewable Energy has the answers. As one of the market leaders, we combine technological innovations, experience, and expertise to deliver readily available, one-stop solutions and have a proven track record of successfully delivering wind power projects on all continents. SGRE is currently seeking highly talented and motivated candidates for Wind Service Technician positions.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Location:\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Medicine Hat, AB (Cypress, Forty Mile, Rattlesnake, Brooks)\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Relocation may be offered for this role should it be necessary. We will also provide GWO (Global Wind Organization) training.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Position Overview\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li> The ideal candidate will have the ability to diagnose and resolve problems independently and efficiently. They will provide excellent service to our customers, could work on complex systems in challenging environments, and participate in the development of new field procedures and best practices. Safety and Quality form a central part of our culture, and the ideal candidate will have a strong focus on both.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Travel could be over 50% in the first year of employment for training purposes, followed by 10% travel in the following years per business needs.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Responsibilities:\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li> Service and maintenance of wind turbines<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Troubleshoot errors on wind turbine<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Escalate technical issues to supporting engineering functions<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Although this position will have a home wind farm site, it will at times require supporting other sites across Canada, as needed<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Provide excellent service to our customers<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Participate in the development of new improved field procedures and best practices<\u002Fli>\n  <li> The working environment entails working inside the wind turbine enclosure at an elevated height of ~ 300 feet<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Ability to think clearly and maintain composure during stressful and or hazardous situations is a critical ability to working in confined spaces<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Extensive training and testing will be provided covering safety and technical job requirements<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Physical requirements of the job include but not limited to: Ladder climbing minimum 250 steps, up stair climbing, standing for long periods, walking, lifting, bending, twisting, work above shoulders, pushing, pulling, exposure to vibration, chemicals, confined spaces and extreme weather conditions<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Able to expand technical ability<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Capable of efficiently taking on additional roles and responsibilities at an operating wind farm<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Required Knowledge\u002F Skills, Education, and Experience\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li> Driving is an essential function of the job and applicants must have a <div>\n  It takes the brightest minds to be a technology leader. It takes imagination to create green energy for the generations to come. At Siemens Gamesa we make real what matters, join our global team.\n <\u002Fdiv> Performs technical, mainly pre-defined tasks for accomplishing defined service delivery work for customer equipment.\n <div>\n   Siemens Gamesa (SGRE) is currently seeking highly talented and motivated candidates for a Wind Technician position. The candidate will work together with a multi-disciplinary group to ensure top performance on our wind farms. The ideal candidate has the ability to work a flexible schedule, along with the ability to analyze and resolve problems independently and efficiently. They will provide excellent service to our customers, have the ability to work on complex systems in challenging environments, and participate in the development of new field procedures and best practices. Safety and Quality form a central part of our culture, and the ideal candidate will have a strong focus on both.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Responsibilities:\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li>Performs mainly pre-defined, technical tasks (for example, basic commissioning of products and systems, integration of components to a system, basic engineering, maintenance jobs) and work packages on-site and remotely.<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Supports customer remotely and onsite, and provides 2nd and 3rd level user support in case of arising issues.<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Coordinates and accomplishes defined service operations and\u002For resolves product issues for customers equipment.<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Supports in generating sales leads for pre-defined service offers and contributes to planning activities.<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Adheres to defined processes and applicable regulations.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div>\n   #Entry\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Qualifications:\n  <br> \n  <ul>\n   <li>Must have minimum of 6 months experience in a mechanical, electrical or industrial field.<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Must pass a physical administered by a medical practitioner to ensure ability to safely perform the job functions and meet the physical demands of the position<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Excellent customer service skills and communication skills are required.<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Good computer skills; intermediate user of Microsoft Office applications.<\u002Fli>\n   <li>The candidate must demonstrate strong initiative and motivation to learn new tasks and technologies.<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Demonstrated ability in working safely and effectively in a team environment.<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Being a Team player is essential.<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Strong ability to organize and plan daily\u002Fweekly work in a dynamic environment.<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Travel to customer sites within and outside Canada is a requirement of the job. Must be eligible to hold a valid Passport and Driver’s License.<\u002Fli>\n   <li>On-the-job training will be provided on the administrative tasks that are required of this role.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Preferred Knowledge\u002FSkills, Education and Experience -\n  <br> \n  <ul>\n   <li>College diploma from a Renewable Energy or Wind Technician Program.<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Hands on work experience as a Wind Technician on a Wind Farm with experience on Siemens geared or direct drive wind turbine technology.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <i> Siemens Gamesa Renewable Energy Limited (SGRE) is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment.<\u002Fi>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <i> Siemens Gamesa is an equal opportunity employer and maintains a work environment that is free from discrimination and where employees are treated with dignity and respect. Siemens Gamesa does not discriminate against any employee or job applicant on the basis of race, ethnicity, nationality, ancestry, genetic information, citizenship, religion, age, gender, gender identity\u002Fexpression, sexual orientation, pregnancy, marital status, disability or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, rules or regulations. which will be located in Alberta (Calgary \u002F Medicine Hat area near Lamond ).\n    <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Responsibilities:\n service to our customers, analyze and react to people in stressful hazardous situations\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Participate in the development of new improved field Manager, you will be responsible for coordination of contract obligations and claims management\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n    Siemens Gamesa Renewable Energy Limited has a flexible work arrangement policy.\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n    Essential Duties &amp; Responsibilities:\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <ul>\n   <li> For complex contracts and customer claims, ensures adherence to contract terms and full claim recovery<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Performs contract analysis\u002Freading and presents Contract and Claim Strategy for portfolio<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Prepares and Updates project claim strategy defining fundamental objectives, roles, responsibilities and processes for claim management in agreement with project team<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Participates in project hand-over, risk and opportunities meetings, project status meetings (internal and external) and internal approval processes (SBA) during the project execution phase when necessary and called upon by the PM<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Support in identify and advising on risks and opportunities<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Together with the project planner, monitors schedule changes against contractual key dates \u002F milestones to avoid liquidated damages or enable revenue share.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> In the event of a claim, ensures contractual notice periods are adhered to<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Consults with and seeks advice from legal department in case of ambiguity or interpretation issues of contract clauses<\u002Fli>\n   <li> In order to identify, pursue, or defend potential claims, CIM reviews event information, advises the team on the need for further records or preservation of evidence<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Supports claim owner in notifying, assessing, assessing\u002Fdefending, negotiating and monitoring identified claims and in preparing and conducting claim negotiations<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Supports legal department in case of Dispute resolution and arbitration \u002F court proceedings<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Other Special Projects as assigned<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Person can work from home\u002Fremotely<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n    Required skills, experience, and education:\n Demand for electricity generated from renewable sources is growing fast, and Siemens Gamesa Renewable Energy has the answers. As one of the market leaders, we combine technological innovations, experience, and expertise to deliver readily available, one-stop solutions and have a proven track record of successfully delivering wind power projects on all continents. SGRE is currently seeking highly talented and motivated candidates for Wind Service Technician positions.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Location:\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Fort MacLeod, AB (Windrise, Sterling, Old Man 2)\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Relocation may be offered for this role should it be necessary. They will provide excellent service to our customers, could work on complex systems in challenging environments, and participate in the development of new field procedures and best practices. Safety and Quality form a central part of our culture, and the ideal candidate will have a strong focus on both.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Travel could be over 50% in the first year of employment for training purposes, followed by 10% travel in the following years per business needs.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Responsibilities:\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li> Service and maintenance of wind turbines<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Troubleshoot errors on wind turbine<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Escalate technical issues to supporting engineering functions<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Although this position will have a home wind farm site, it will at times require supporting other sites across Canada, as needed<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Provide excellent service to our customers<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Participate in the development of new improved field procedures and best practices<\u002Fli>\n  <li> The working environment entails working inside the wind turbine enclosure at an elevated height of ~ 300 feet<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Ability to think clearly and maintain composure during stressful and or hazardous situations is a critical ability to working in confined spaces<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Extensive training and testing will be provided covering safety and technical job requirements<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Physical requirements of the job include but not limited to: Ladder climbing minimum 250 steps, up stair climbing, standing for long periods, walking, lifting, bending, twisting, work above shoulders, pushing, pulling, exposure to vibration, chemicals, confined spaces and extreme weather conditions<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Able to expand technical ability<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Capable of efficiently taking on additional roles and responsibilities at an operating wind farm<\u002Fli>\n <li> Physically and mentally able to work suspended from heights and in confined spaces<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Flexible travel schedule<\u002Fli>\n  <li> High school diploma or equivalent<\u002Fli>\n  <li> As one of the market leaders, we combine technological innovations, experience, and expertise to deliver readily available, one-stop solutions and have a proven track record of successfully delivering wind power projects on all continents.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Siemens Gamesa Renewable Energy is searching for advanced turbine technicians that are willing and capable of leading and \u002F or being part of our Heavy Lifts and Large Corrective teams. Employees must maintain a valid license and acceptable driving record and may be subject to periodic DMV checks of their license.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li> High school diploma or equivalent<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Willing to travel up to 100%<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Work a flexible work schedule<\u002Fli>\n  <li> The Wind Service Travel Technician position requires 100% travel so qualified candidates must live within 50 miles of a major airport.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Qualified Applicants must be legally authorized for employment in the United States.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Preferred Qualifications:\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li> SIEMENS Lvl. 6 Troubleshooter Certification<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Liftra Crane Experience<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Liftra Operator Certification<\u002Fli>\n  <li> G.E. and Vestas Major Component Exchange Experience<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Crew Lead experience<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Training role experience<\u002Fli>\n  <li> QEHS Experience (Quality, Environmental, Health, and Safety)<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Qualified Applicants will not require employer sponsored work authorization now or in the future for employment in the United States.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n    # <div>\n  It takes the brightest minds to be a technology leader. It takes imagination to create green energy for the generations to come. At Siemens Gamesa we make real what matters, join our global team.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   This position will be for a new wind farm which will be located in Alberta (Drumheller area).\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Responsibilities:\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li> Responsible for the service and maintenance of Siemens Gamesa wind turbines at our Saskatchewan Wind Turbine site<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Responsible for daily site operations and administerial duties<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Although this position will have a home wind farm site, it will at times require supporting other sites across Canada, as needed<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Provide excellent service to our customers, analyze and react to people in stressful hazardous situations<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Participate in the development of new improved field procedures and best practices<\u002Fli>\n  <li> The working environment entails working inside the wind turbine enclosure at an elevated height of ~ 300 feet<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Ability to think clearly and maintain composure during stressful and or hazardous situations is a critical ability to working in confined spaces<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Extensive training and testing will be provided covering safety and technical job requirements<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Physical requirements of the job include but not limited to: Ladder climbing minimum 267 steps, up stair climbing, standing for long periods, walking, lifting, bending, twisting, work above shoulders, pushing, pulling, exposure to vibration, chemicals, confined spaces and extreme weather conditions<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Able to expand technical ability<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Capable of efficiently taking on additional roles and responsibilities at an operating wind farm<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Travel to customer sites within and outside Canada is a requirement of the job.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Qualifications:\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li> Supervisory experience preferably in a field service environment<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Excellent customer service skills and communication skills are required<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Demonstrated ability to work safely and effectively in a team environment<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Strong ability to organize and plan daily\u002Fweekly work with a high level of quality, ability to analyze and resolve problems independently with a high level of results orientation<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Good computer skills, is competent in the use of Microsoft platforms like Outlook and Excel<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Capable of fulfilling daily turbine systems Technician desired<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Demonstrating capabilities to become a Trouble shooting Technician Required<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Be able to travel international as required<\u002Fli>\n  <li> College Diploma or equivalent competency in a field related to the work of a wind farm technician ie: electrical \u002F mechanical system desired<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Must be eligible to hold a valid Passport and Driver’s License<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Must be legally able to work in Canada<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Additionally the Working Site <div>\n  It takes the brightest minds to be a technology leader. It takes imagination to create green energy for the generations to come. At Siemens Gamesa we make real what matters, join our global team.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Join one of the world’s leading suppliers of wind power solutions as a Wind Technician for Siemens Gamesa Renewable Energy! Demand for electricity generated from renewable sources is growing fast, and Siemens Gamesa Renewable Energy has the answers. As one of the market leaders, we combine technological innovations, experience, and expertise to deliver readily available, one-stop solutions and have a proven track record of successfully delivering wind power projects on all continents. SGRE is currently seeking a highly talented and motivated candidate for a Senvion Lead Wind Technician position. The candidate will work together with a multi-disciplinary group to ensure top performance on Wind Farms ranging from the Woodstock to Windsor area. The ideal candidate can work a flexible schedule, along with the ability to analyze and resolve problems independently and efficiently. S\u002Fhe will provide excellent service to our customers, can work on complex systems in challenging environments, and participate in the development of new field procedures and best practices. The candidate will be responsible for two Senvion sites operations which are in Woodstock and Harrow Ontario. Ideally the candidate would be located between the Kitchener and Woodstock Ontario area . The candidate would also assist at other sites, as needed in the Port Dover and Grand Valley region.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Responsibilities:\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li> Provide excellent service to our customers, analyze, and react to people in stressful hazardous situations<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Participate in the development of new improved field procedures and best practices<\u002Fli>\n  <li> The working environment entails working inside the wind turbine enclosure at an elevated height of 300 feet<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Ability to think clearly and maintain composure during stressful and or hazardous situations is a critical ability to working in confined spaces<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Extensive training and testing will be provided covering safety and technical job requirements<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Physical requirements of the job include but not limited to: Ladder climbing minimum 267 steps, up stair climbing, standing for long periods, walking, lifting, bending, twisting, work above shoulders, pushing, pulling, exposure to vibration, chemicals, confined spaces, and extreme weather conditions<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Able to expand technical ability<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Capable of efficiently taking on additional roles and responsibilities at an operating wind farm<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Performs mainly pre-defined, technical tasks (for example, basic commissioning of products and systems, integration of components to a system, basic engineering, maintenance jobs) and work packages on-site and remotely.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Supports customers remotely and onsite and provide 2nd and 3rd level user support in case of arising issues.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Coordinates and accomplishes defined service operations and\u002For resolves product issues for customers equipment.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Supports in generating sales leads for pre-defined service offers and contributes to planning activities.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Adheres to defined processes and applicable regulations.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Qualifications:\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li> Senvion Platform experience<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Leadership \u002F Supervisor experience<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Must presently reside in Canada. Must be eligible to hold a valid Passport and Driver’s License as travel to customer sites within and outside Canada is a requirement of the job.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Demonstrated knowledge in electrical systems including such as PLC programming and converters<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <ul>\n  <li> College Diploma or equivalent competency in a field related to the work of a wind farm technician i.e.: electrical \u002F mechanical systems<\u002Fli>\n  <li> The candidate must demonstrate strong initiative and motivation to learn new technology and translate learning into personal success<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Excellent customer service skills and communication skills are required<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Demonstrated ability to work safely and effectively in a team environment<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Strong ability to organize and plan daily\u002Fweekly work with a high level of quality orientation, ability to analyze and resolve problems independently with a high level of results orientation<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Good computer skills, is competent in the use of Microsoft platforms like Outlook and Excel<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   To learn more about Siemens Gamesa, check out these videos:\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Empowering our people\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n    https:\u002F\u002Fwww.siemensgamesa.com\u002Fsustainability\u002Femployees\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   How do you imagine the future?\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n    https:\u002F\u002Fyoutu.be\u002F12Sm678tjuY\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Siemens Gamesa Renewable Energy is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. <div>\n  It takes the brightest minds to be a technology leader. It takes imagination to create green energy for the generations to come. At Siemens Gamesa we make real what matters, join our global team.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Position Overview\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li> The ideal candidate will have the ability to lead, analyze and resolve problems independently and efficiently. They will provide excellent service to our customers, could work on complex systems in challenging environments, and participate in the development of new field procedures and best practices. Safety and Quality form a central part of our culture, and the ideal candidate will have a strong focus on both.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Lead daily site operations<\u002Fli>\n  <li> This Lead Technician position will be for a new wind farm which will be located in Alberta (Medicine Hat area).<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Travel could be over 50% in the first year of employment for training purposes, followed by 10% travel in the following years per business needs.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Relocation may be offered for this role should it be necessary.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Responsibilities:\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li> Site level support to the Site Manager (SM).<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Leading Safety\u002FQuality Culture onsite.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Report any Health. Safety, &amp; Environmental (HSE), Quality, etc. violations to the SM immediately.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Drive continuous process improvements.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Training assessments (technical and non-technical)<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Support the SM in performance reviews for technicians<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Service and maintenance wind turbines.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Troubleshoot errors on wind turbine.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Prepare plan of the day (POD) and assign tasks to the team, in close communication with the SM.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Assure the site level team is working safely, performing the work according to the work instructions, and working efficiently.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Site level communication with the customer.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Perform downtime allocations as per the contract, as directed by the SM.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Assure timely submittal of all required documentation (service checklists, retrofits\u002Fupgrade documentation, work orders, time sheets, expense reports, etc.).<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Escalate any human performance concerns to the SM.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Escalate technical issues to the SM, or directly communicate with first and second level support teams.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Perform site inventory as required.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Order consumables and other office supplies, as needed or as directed by the SM.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Assure proper packaging etc. of parts to be shipped off site.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> The working environment entails working inside the wind turbine enclosure at an elevated height of ~ 300 feet<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Physical requirements of the job include but not limited to: Ladder climbing minimum 250 steps, up stair climbing, standing for long periods, walking, lifting, bending, twisting, work above shoulders, pushing, pulling, exposure to vibration, chemicals, confined spaces and extreme weather conditions<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Required Knowledge\u002F Skills, Education, and Experience\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li> Management and\u002For Team Leadership experience or applicable work experience<\u002Fli>\n  <li> High school diploma or equivalent<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Driving is an essential function of the job and applicants must have a valid driver’s license at the time of application with an acceptable driving record. Employees must maintain a valid license and acceptable driving record and may be subject to periodic driver’s abstract checks<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Must be eligible to hold a valid Passport<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Physically and mentally able to work suspended from heights and in confined spaces<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Be self-motivated, able to think quickly and address issues as they arise<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Demonstrated ability to work safely and effectively in a team environment<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Excellent customer service skills and communication skills are required<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Proficiency in Microsoft software suite (Word, Excel, Power Point).<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Ability to climb to heights up to 250 feet or greater and work in confined spaces.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Must meet body weight restrictions of 265 pounds or less as required by the safety regulations.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Must pass a physical administered by a medical practitioner to ensure ability to safely perform the job functions and meet the physical demands of the position.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Must pass pre-hire background screening<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Must be legally able to work in Canada<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Preferred Knowledge\u002F Skills, Education, and Experience\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li> Minimum of 6 months experience in a mechanical, electrical or industrial field<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Conflict resolution experience<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Contract management experience<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Relevant work experience e.g. electrical, mechanical, hydraulic, maintenance\u002Ftroubleshooting in a military, industrial or automotive industry.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> SAP experience<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Hands on work experience as a Wind Technician on a Wind Farm<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   To learn more about Siemens Gamesa, check out these videos:\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Empowering our people\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  It takes the brightest minds to be a technology leader. It takes imagination to create green energy for the generations to come. At Siemens Gamesa we make real what matters, join our global team.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Position Overview\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Join one of the world’s leading suppliers of wind power solutions as a Wind Technician for Siemens Gamesa Renewable Energy! Demand for electricity generated from renewable sources is growing fast, and Siemens Gamesa Renewable Energy has the answers. As one of the market leaders, we combine technological innovations, experience, and expertise to deliver readily available, one-stop solutions and have a proven track record of successfully delivering wind power projects on all continents. SGRE is currently seeking a highly talented and motivated candidate for a Wind Technician position. The candidate will work together with a multi-disciplinary group to ensure top performance on Wind Farms ranging from the Woodstock to Windsor area. The ideal candidate can work a flexible schedule, along with the ability to analyze and resolve problems independently and efficiently. S\u002Fhe will provide excellent service to our customers, can work on complex systems in challenging environments, and participate in the development of new field procedures and best practices. The candidate, with an already active partner, will be responsible for two Senvion sites operations which are in Woodstock and Harrow Ontario. Ideally the candidate would be located between the Kitchener and Woodstock Ontario area. The candidate would also assist at other sites, as needed, in the Port Dover and Grand Valley region.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Responsibilities\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li> Provide excellent service to our customers, analyze, and react to people in stressful hazardous situations<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Participate in the development of new improved field procedures and best practices<\u002Fli>\n  <li> The working environment entails working inside the wind turbine enclosure at an elevated height of 300 feet<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Ability to think clearly and maintain composure during stressful and or hazardous situations is a critical ability to working in confined spaces<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Extensive training and testing will be provided covering safety and technical job requirements<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Physical requirements of the job include but not limited to: Ladder climbing minimum 267 steps, up stair climbing, standing for long periods, walking, lifting, bending, twisting, work above shoulders, pushing, pulling, exposure to vibration, chemicals, confined spaces and extreme weather conditions<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Able to expand technical ability<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Capable of efficiently taking on additional roles and responsibilities at an operating wind farm<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Performs mainly pre-defined, technical tasks (for example, basic commissioning of products and systems, integration of components to a system, basic engineering, maintenance jobs) and work packages on-site and remotely.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Supports customers remotely and onsite and provide 2nd and 3rd level user support in case of arising issues.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Coordinates and accomplishes defined service operations and\u002For resolves product issues for customers equipment.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Supports in generating sales leads for pre-defined service offers and contributes to planning activities.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Adheres to defined processes and applicable regulations.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Qualifications:\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li> Turbine experience, especially Senvion Platform is preferred<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Demonstrated knowledge in electrical systems including such as PLC programming and converters<\u002Fli>\n  <li> College Diploma or equivalent competency in a field related to the work of a wind farm technician ie: electrical \u002F mechanical systems<\u002Fli>\n  <li> The candidate must demonstrate strong initiative and motivation to learn new technology and translate learning into personal success<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Excellent customer service skills and communication skills are required<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Demonstrated ability to work safely and effectively in a team environment<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Strong ability to organize and plan daily\u002Fweekly work with a high level of quality orientation, ability to analyze and resolve problems independently with a high level of results orientation<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Good computer skills, is competent in the use of Microsoft platforms like Outlook and Excel<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Must be legally able to work in Canada, and presently reside in Canada. Also, travel to customer sites within and outside Canada is a requirement of the job. Must be eligible to hold a valid Passport and Driver’s License<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   #Entry\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   To learn more about Siemens Gamesa, check out these videos:\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Empowering our people\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n    https:\u002F\u002Fwww.siemensgamesa.com\u002Fsustainability\u002Femployees\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <br> How do you imagine the future?\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n    https:\u002F\u002Fyoutu.be\u002F12Sm678tjuY\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Siemens Gamesa Renewable Energy Limited (SGRE) is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. <div>\n  It takes the brightest minds to be a technology leader. It takes imagination to create green energy for the generations to come. At Siemens Gamesa we make real what matters, join our global team.\n <\u002Fdiv> Performs technical, mainly pre-defined tasks for accomplishing defined service delivery work for customer equipment.\n <div>\n   Siemens Gamesa (SGRE) is currently seeking highly talented and motivated candidates for a Wind Technician position. The candidate will work together with a multi-disciplinary group to ensure top performance on our wind farms. The ideal candidate has the ability to work a flexible schedule, along with the ability to analyze and resolve problems independently and efficiently. They will provide excellent service to our customers, have the ability to work on complex systems in challenging environments, and participate in the development of new field procedures and best practices. Safety and Quality form a central part of our culture, and the ideal candidate will have a strong focus on both.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Responsibilities:\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li>Performs mainly pre-defined, technical tasks (for example, basic commissioning of products and systems, integration of components to a system, basic engineering, maintenance jobs) and work packages on-site and remotely.<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Supports customer remotely and onsite, and provides 2nd and 3rd level user support in case of arising issues.<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Coordinates and accomplishes defined service operations and\u002For resolves product issues for customers equipment.<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Supports in generating sales leads for pre-defined service offers and contributes to planning activities.<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Adheres to defined processes and applicable regulations.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div>\n   #Entry\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Qualifications:\n  <br> \n  <ul>\n   <li>Must have minimum of 6 months experience in a mechanical, electrical or<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   industrial field.\n  <br> \n  <ul>\n   <li>Must pass a physical administered by a medical practitioner to ensure ability to safely perform the job functions and meet the physical demands of the position<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Excellent customer service skills and communication skills are required.<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Good computer skills; intermediate user of Microsoft Office applications.<\u002Fli>\n   <li>The candidate must demonstrate strong initiative and motivation to learn new tasks and technologies.<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Demonstrated ability in working safely and effectively in a team environment.<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Being a Team player is essential.<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Strong ability to organize and plan daily\u002Fweekly work in a dynamic environment.<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Travel to customer sites within and outside Canada is a requirement of the job. Must be eligible to hold a valid Passport and Driver’s License.<\u002Fli>\n   <li>On-the-job training will be provided on the administrative tasks that are required of this role.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Preferred Knowledge\u002FSkills, Education and Experience -\n  <br> \n  <ul>\n   <li>College diploma from a Renewable Energy or Wind Technician Program.<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Hands on work experience as a Wind Technician on a Wind Farm with experience on Siemens geared or direct drive wind turbine technology.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <i> Siemens Gamesa Renewable Energy Limited (SGRE) is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer.
